title: Louis van Gaal spotted in stands for Netherlands' friendly with Italy as hosts search for new manager
text:
Sport Louis van Gaal spotted in stands for Netherlands' friendly with Italy as hosts search for new manager Holland are on the look-out for a new boss after Danny Blind was sacked following the 2-0 loss to Bulgaria over the weekend Share Louis van Gaal was in attendance for the Netherlands' friendly with Italy on Tuesday night (Photo: ANP) Share Get Manchester United FC   Thank you for subscribing!   
Louis van Gaal was photographed in the stands during the Netherlands' friendly defeat by Italy on Tuesday night. 
The former Manchester United boss has managed the Dutch national team twice before and is being linked with a third stint in charge following Danny Blind's exit at the weekend. 
Van Gaal was joined by former England boss Fabio Capello at the Amsterdam Arena. 
Blind was sacked following a shock 2-0 defeat in Bulgaria which left the Netherlands' hopes of qualifying for the 2018 World Cup hanging by a thread. 
Holland took the lead against Italy through a 10th-minute Alessio Romagnoli own-goal but further first-half strikes from Eder and Leonardo Bonucci turned the game on its head by half-time and earned the Azzurri a win. Leonardo Bonucci scored Italy's winner against the Netherlands (Photo: REUTERS) Like us on Facebook
